commit_message:
Gate releases on list-changes jobs

list-changes now checks if the version used matches the release
model, so the test job may now exit in error. Use this job in
the releases repository gate.

Change-Id: I1ca637b4a5675158234c94a842698ffee4396293
Depends-On: I640e6881e626b40f3f3a67094025a691a3f01771

Error out when beta used in non-milestone model

Exit in error when we detect a beta version request in a release
model that is not "cycle-with-milestones".

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-09 21:12:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/filters/availability_zone_filter.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_aggregate_multitenancy_isolation_filters.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/aggregate_multitenancy_isolation.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_utils.py'], 'message': "aggregate_metadata_get_by_host cleanup

Previosly function 'aggregate_metadata_get_by_host' can return
all host metadata if it contains some specific 'key'. Actually,
this functionality wasn't used anywhere. Moreover, for specific 'key'
we had another 'aggregate_values_from_key' function, that returns
all metadata values for this particular 'key'.

So 'aggregate_metadata_get_by_host' function was changed to return
just all metadata for specific host.

Change-Id: I4ff739ba2adb123e65b8b48bedb5fc13c27557fa
"}]
commit_message:
aggregate_metadata_get_by_host cleanup

Previosly function 'aggregate_metadata_get_by_host' can return
all host metadata if it contains some specific 'key'. Actually,
this functionality wasn't used anywhere. Moreover, for specific 'key'
we had another 'aggregate_values_from_key' function, that returns
all metadata values for this particular 'key'.

So 'aggregate_metadata_get_by_host' function was changed to return
just all metadata for specific host.

Change-Id: I4ff739ba2adb123e65b8b48bedb5fc13c27557fa

commit_message:
Updated tox.ini to pick up requirements from upper constraints

Openstack infra now supports the upper constraints. So, this patch
updates the tox.ini to pick requirements from openstack/requirements
directly. Also added tox_install.sh script.

Change-Id: I8d0f1984ead5b633e5f36cab78803154bec540c7
Closes-Bug: #1614361

subject: Support xyz_update purging metadata
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-11-05 09:42:16.000000000', 'files': ['senlinclient/common/utils.py', 'senlinclient/tests/unit/test_utils.py'], 'message': "Support xyz_update purging metadata

xyz_update's metadata can be added and modified.
But if one or multiple key:value was added to metadata,
it can't be recovered.
This patch support purging metadata.

Closes-Bug: 1637177

Change-Id: Id541b209b2e0a67a5243ccc3099ed3f5a8d13460
"}]
commit_message:
Support xyz_update purging metadata

xyz_update's metadata can be added and modified.
But if one or multiple key:value was added to metadata,
it can't be recovered.
This patch support purging metadata.

Closes-Bug: 1637177

Change-Id: Id541b209b2e0a67a5243ccc3099ed3f5a8d13460

subject: Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 06:54:05.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/common/test_custom_matchers.py'], 'message': 'Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...), and assertIsNotNone(...)
is preferred over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None,
...). Off by default.

More information, see:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Change-Id: I73a9ed3e145b8f36c110725d148baf1fb0aef957
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...), and assertIsNotNone(...)
is preferred over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None,
...). Off by default.

More information, see:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Change-Id: I73a9ed3e145b8f36c110725d148baf1fb0aef957

subject: Reinitialize venv upon install
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 09:14:09.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/install.yml'], 'message': 'Reinitialize venv upon install

Reinitializes (copies python, etc binaries) into the venv when
dropping a new venv into place. This is needed because the Python
binary packaged with the venv may not match the Python running on
the host it is being installed to. (ie. in the case of a Xenial
repo container and a Trusty target host.)

Change-Id: Ibedc836cbab89d82d59c90165cbe064775164742
Partial-Bug: #1637509
'}]
commit_message:
Reinitialize venv upon install

Reinitializes (copies python, etc binaries) into the venv when
dropping a new venv into place. This is needed because the Python
binary packaged with the venv may not match the Python running on
the host it is being installed to. (ie. in the case of a Xenial
repo container and a Trusty target host.)

Change-Id: Ibedc836cbab89d82d59c90165cbe064775164742
Partial-Bug: #1637509

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-15 18:08:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_ip_lib.py'], 'message': "Parse the output of ip route more robustly

The code parsing the output of ip route assumes that the output is the
destination network, and then key/value pairs. This is not necessarily
the case, as the output may contain flags.

This change modifies the parsing of ip route's output to look
specifically for the keys of interest, and read their values

Closes-Bug: 1640008

"}]
commit_message:
Parse the output of ip route more robustly

The code parsing the output of ip route assumes that the output is the
destination network, and then key/value pairs. This is not necessarily
the case, as the output may contain flags.

This change modifies the parsing of ip route's output to look
specifically for the keys of interest, and read their values
exclusively.

Closes-Bug: 1640008

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py

Change-Id: I34b6c0afb05550c970b1cacda8ec472294215403
(cherry picked from commit 7647e3e56f630708ad4da12ba1af429d49ac1fc1)

subject: Fix up Newton->Ocata rabbitmq ha policy
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6681, 'name': 'Brent Eagles', 'email': 'beagles@redhat.com', 'username': 'beagles'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-14 09:35:08.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_1.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker_migrations.sh'], 'message': 'Fix up Newton->Ocata rabbitmq ha policy

In ocata we changed the ha policy to "ha-exactly" via the following changes:
- tht: Iace6daf27a76cb8ef1050ada0de7ff1f530916c6
- puppet-tripleo: Ib62001c03e1e08f58cf0c6e0ba07a8879a584084

We initially also took care of changing this policy (which is set in the
pacemaker resource agent) for the M/N upgrade path:
I2468a096b5d7042bc801a742a7a85fb1521c1c02

In the end we decided against changing the policy in Newton as well (it
was only for ocata) as it was too close to the release date and we took
the safer path.
This patch does two things:
1) It renames the upgrade function to "newton_ocata" since that is the
only upgrade path we need to take care of
2) It reinstates the actual upgrade function which was mistakenly
removed via an unrelated change in the ceilometer upgrade path:
If9d6987cd0a8fc5d3f9de518ba422d97d5149732

Closes-Bug: #1628998

Change-Id: I3a97505d2ae1ae27f3080ffe74c33fdabffd2420
'}]
commit_message:
Fix up Newton->Ocata rabbitmq ha policy

In ocata we changed the ha policy to "ha-exactly" via the following changes:
- tht: Iace6daf27a76cb8ef1050ada0de7ff1f530916c6
- puppet-tripleo: Ib62001c03e1e08f58cf0c6e0ba07a8879a584084

We initially also took care of changing this policy (which is set in the
pacemaker resource agent) for the M/N upgrade path:
I2468a096b5d7042bc801a742a7a85fb1521c1c02

In the end we decided against changing the policy in Newton as well (it
was only for ocata) as it was too close to the release date and we took
the safer path.
This patch does two things:
1) It renames the upgrade function to "newton_ocata" since that is the
only upgrade path we need to take care of
2) It reinstates the actual upgrade function which was mistakenly
removed via an unrelated change in the ceilometer upgrade path:
If9d6987cd0a8fc5d3f9de518ba422d97d5149732

Closes-Bug: #1628998

Change-Id: I3a97505d2ae1ae27f3080ffe74c33fdabffd2420

commit_message:
Reinitialize venv upon install

Reinitializes (copies python, etc binaries) into the venv when
dropping a new venv into place. This is needed because the Python
binary packaged with the venv may not match the Python running on
the host it is being installed to. (ie. in the case of a Xenial
repo container and a Trusty target host.)

Change-Id: If20462b0d57ee8ec11a479dbaf463e1cd309ac97
Partial-Bug: #1637509

commit_message:
Make service_checks easier to run independently of kolla-ansible

Set a default for CONFIG_DIR in service_checks to more easily allow
consumers not using the kolla-ansible tool to run the prechecks.

Change-Id: I78bc5dd6f37e6a60ecc6a86d43e56b05803a4fd5
Closes-Bug: #1629893

subject: py3:Remove six.iterXXX
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-08 09:19:07.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/workflows/views.py', 'horizon/middleware/base.py'], 'message': 'py3:Remove six.iterXXX

1、As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems/keys
achieve iterators. We can use dict.items/keys instead, as it wil
l return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable.
2、In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/ 2015-June/066391.html

TrivialFix.

Change-Id: I9eb7c4a2b2f3a070735c610942538c8185eee3c6
'}]
commit_message:
py3:Remove six.iterXXX

1、As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems/keys
achieve iterators. We can use dict.items/keys instead, as it wil
l return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable.
2、In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/ 2015-June/066391.html

TrivialFix.

Change-Id: I9eb7c4a2b2f3a070735c610942538c8185eee3c6

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-25 14:22:56.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/tests/test_build_utils.py', 'fuel_agent/utils/build.py'], 'message': "Use --force-yes when installing packages

Sometimes packages from Mirantis repo have versions
lower then in upstream, and apt-get install refuses to
downgrade packages without '--force-yes'.

This request adds this option.

Change-Id: I87968d40f66da3e5666e200082af8f124697dc97
"}]
commit_message:
Use --force-yes when installing packages

Sometimes packages from Mirantis repo have versions
lower then in upstream, and apt-get install refuses to
downgrade packages without '--force-yes'.

This request adds this option.

Change-Id: I87968d40f66da3e5666e200082af8f124697dc97

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-05-18 14:35:39.000000000', 'files': ['bin/disk-image-create', 'bin/disk-image-get-kernel', 'elements/package-installs/extra-data.d/99-squash-package-install'], 'message': "Allow dib to be lauched from venv

For some reason it's not possible to build an image with dib
completely from virtual environment - you have to install dib-utils in
your system first in order to have dib-run-parts and other commands.

Creating venv with all requirements doesn't solve the problem
because some paths are calculated wrong (e.g. $_LIB).

This patch allows to run disk-image-create completely from virtual
environment with a command like this:

    $ tox -e venv -- disk-image-create vm ubuntu -o ../ubuntu.qcow2

Of course, it's also possible to create venv, activate it and
run the command from the environment, like shown below:

    $ tox -e venv -- pip freeze
    $ source .tox/venv/bin/activate
    $ disk-image-create vm ubuntu -o ../ubuntu.qcow2
    $ deactivate

Change-Id: I2324e6021da362a92e5a7991508756e8513a0bcb
"}]
commit_message:
Allow dib to be lauched from venv

For some reason it's not possible to build an image with dib
completely from virtual environment - you have to install dib-utils in
your system first in order to have dib-run-parts and other commands.

Creating venv with all requirements doesn't solve the problem
because some paths are calculated wrong (e.g. $_LIB).

This patch allows to run disk-image-create completely from virtual
environment with a command like this:

    $ tox -e venv -- disk-image-create vm ubuntu -o ../ubuntu.qcow2

Of course, it's also possible to create venv, activate it and
run the command from the environment, like shown below:

    $ tox -e venv -- pip freeze
    $ source .tox/venv/bin/activate
    $ disk-image-create vm ubuntu -o ../ubuntu.qcow2
    $ deactivate

Change-Id: I2324e6021da362a92e5a7991508756e8513a0bcb

commit_message:
Add !requiretty to sudoers config in install document

When we use devstack to start ironic-inspector service, it starts
sucessfully because we have a tty in devstack screen. But when we try
to use service command to start it, we should add '!requiretty'in the
suoders config, or it will fail.

Change-Id: I1f9f539c8eafea726ca7015ef86773e26a5a5641

From time to time we need to create a VM with murano from
master branch. One of the possible ways to do it is to start
every murano component using tox in a separate screen window.

Although it is not a hard task, it requires a lot of actions
to be done, and it is quite easy to made a mistake doing this
frequiently.

This script automates such common actions as starting new
screen session with logging, stopping it, and doing some
preparation tasks.

Change-Id: I8f5a89f828c9f18cc488176074ea933ef9769318
'}]
commit_message:
Manage murano development box

From time to time we need to create a VM with murano from
master branch. One of the possible ways to do it is to start
every murano component using tox in a separate screen window.

Although it is not a hard task, it requires a lot of actions
to be done, and it is quite easy to made a mistake doing this
frequiently.

This script automates such common actions as starting new
screen session with logging, stopping it, and doing some
preparation tasks.

Change-Id: I8f5a89f828c9f18cc488176074ea933ef9769318

commit_message:
Replace ceilometer-dbsync by ceilometer-upgrade

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/388688/ has removed ceilometer-dbsync so
ceilometer-upgrade must be used instead.

Additionally, ceilometer-dbsync enabled option --skip-gnocchi-resource-types
and ceilometer-upgrade doesn't, so i'm setting it by default to ensure backwards compatibility.

Note this is based on the corresponding fix to puppet-ceilometer ref

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396570

Change-Id: Ic0a15c75d1cd3e3f70eeafd9ba09d50c58cc1293
Closes-Bug: #1641076

subject: Fix fact gathering when using --limit
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-15 18:26:35.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/site.yml'], 'message': 'Fix fact gathering when using --limit

If an operator wants to deploy a single node (e.g. add an additional
compute), they may want to use the --limit feature of Ansible to avoid
waiting for every play across every node.

The problem with this is that --limit will gather facts for that node
only, causing template errors such as the infamous ('dict object' has no
attribute u'ansible_eth0'").

Ansible has catered to this problem to an extent with it's
"delegate_facts" mechanism. The only problem is that in the default 'all
nodes' case, we end up with a storm of SSHs as each node SSHs to every
other. I'm solving this with a separate task to only use this mechanism
when a subset of nodes has been specified (see ansible_play_batch).

Useful links on this subject:
- https://medium.com/@george.shuklin/perfecting-forced-fact-gathering-in-ansible-1611f9c8d0d5#.tr5zs3e7x
- http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/playbooks_delegation.html#delegated-facts

Change-Id: Ibb691eae15cacd9e5129ae9280fd296f5ba95940
Closes-Bug: 1642004
'}]
commit_message:
Fix fact gathering when using --limit

If an operator wants to deploy a single node (e.g. add an additional
compute), they may want to use the --limit feature of Ansible to avoid
waiting for every play across every node.

The problem with this is that --limit will gather facts for that node
only, causing template errors such as the infamous ('dict object' has no
attribute u'ansible_eth0'").

Ansible has catered to this problem to an extent with it's
"delegate_facts" mechanism. The only problem is that in the default 'all
nodes' case, we end up with a storm of SSHs as each node SSHs to every
other. I'm solving this with a separate task to only use this mechanism
when a subset of nodes has been specified (see ansible_play_batch).

Useful links on this subject:
- https://medium.com/@george.shuklin/perfecting-forced-fact-gathering-in-ansible-1611f9c8d0d5#.tr5zs3e7x
- http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/playbooks_delegation.html#delegated-facts

Change-Id: Ibb691eae15cacd9e5129ae9280fd296f5ba95940
Closes-Bug: 1642004

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-05 10:11:22.000000000', 'files': ['elements/devuser/README.rst', 'elements/devuser/install.d/50-devuser'], 'message': "Enable ssh password authentication for devuser

Add the option for devuser to authenticate by password.
The devuser element already has the option to set the password.
Setting the password is disabled by default and documented as
unsecured. However, if the user choose to set it despite the warning,
he won't be able to connect with this user and password through ssh
as the password authentication flag of sshd_config is disabled by
default.

Change-Id: Ie27f5acf8438c71e660243198d8bac3f7daf384a
"}]
commit_message:
Enable ssh password authentication for devuser

Add the option for devuser to authenticate by password.
The devuser element already has the option to set the password.
Setting the password is disabled by default and documented as
unsecured. However, if the user choose to set it despite the warning,
he won't be able to connect with this user and password through ssh
as the password authentication flag of sshd_config is disabled by
default.

Change-Id: Ie27f5acf8438c71e660243198d8bac3f7daf384a

commit_message:
Refactor inventory management filesystem

Segmenting the storage-related operations from the rest of the
inventory management tooling, in support of better maintainability
testability and future support for alternate storage options.

Some changes were made in the course of the refactor to facilitate
future changes.

The include_cwd parameter was removed in the course of the refactor
as it was determined to be unused and unneededduring patch set
review.

Change-Id: Iaa9761a73a626c4f02c7662b119881a79397d690

commit_message:
Drop unused parameter in class EntryCreateTask

In this class and it's related modules I have not found this
unused db_api parameters. And I think function parameters in
execute are got from taskflow.
So I think we can delete it.

Change-Id: Iad9e0ebe7d03210efe30964623e69a57d9fb0d18

subject: Don't refresh info_cache while a instance gets deleted
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 11:46:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py'], 'message': "Don't refresh info_cache while a instance gets deleted

Commit cdb9b6820dc1 added code to refresh Neutron's info_cache after
a associated floating IP was deleted. This fails in case the instance itself
is deleted. The failure is then:

InstanceInfoCacheNotFound: Info cache for instance $UUID could not be found.

So before refreshing the cache, check via the instance task_state that the
instance is not going to be deleted.

Change-Id: I560b28f3ec9e017f6a178bf5120534e21d0b9800
Closes-Bug: #1632403
"}]
commit_message:
Don't refresh info_cache while a instance gets deleted

Commit cdb9b6820dc1 added code to refresh Neutron's info_cache after
a associated floating IP was deleted. This fails in case the instance itself
is deleted. The failure is then:

InstanceInfoCacheNotFound: Info cache for instance $UUID could not be found.

So before refreshing the cache, check via the instance task_state that the
instance is not going to be deleted.

Change-Id: I560b28f3ec9e017f6a178bf5120534e21d0b9800
Closes-Bug: #1632403

commit_message:
modified the description of service.list

The description of service.list is unprecise.
The service.list gets a list of services,
not to get cpu/memory/hdd info for host.

Change-Id: If5994be2f9e67766f7e2a9d786c32f0569b16b3c

commit_message:
[placement] Enforce min_unit, max_unit and step_size

Add support for checking min_unit, max_unit and step_size when
making allocations to the placement API. When the constraints are
violated a new exception InvalidAllocationConstraintsViolated is
raised.

Change-Id: I18596a3c0f2b0049aaccd0f3e73aef90b684c4a8
Closes-Bug: #1623545

commit_message:
Placement api: 404 response do not indicate what was not found

Add informative messages to the 404 error response from
nova/objects/resource_provider.py

For the method _update_inventory_in_db() from resource_provider.py,
gabbi test validation is not added since it is not being used and
from the placement API you create an inventory but then call
set_inventory or add_inventory on a resource_provider.

Similar change, i.e. adding informative messages to 404 error can be
done for api tests from inventory.yaml and usage.yaml

It includes adding informative logging in code for 404 exceptions and
adding gabbi tests for those.
This can be done in follow up patch.

Change-Id: If53f84ac5f7521e9926b97bdcce3cf77ec5b4ffd
Closes-Bug: #1634115

commit_message:
xenapi: calculate reserved_host_memory_mb on host

Currently reserved_host_memory_mb is very hardware dependent, and can
vary between versions of Xen, and many other factors.

We can calculate this by adding up:
* memory used by xen
* memory used for dom0
* memory used for nova-compute vm, if not running in dom0

We can send this to the resource tracker, to override the configuration
variable:
CONF.reserved_host_memory_mb

WIP - do not merge

Change-Id: I2924d037300c875f2c021806fe003f73b440a1c8

commit_message:
Adds support for systemd amphora images

This patch enables auto-detection of the init system used in the
amphora image and adds support for systemd amphora.
This patch allows Ubuntu xenial amphora images to work.
It also merges two functional test files into one file to reduce
code duplication.

This is a scenario gate fix.

Change-Id: I5fec1680bd47719ae9f2fcb6abaaba8a78e2ae8b
Closes-Bug: #1640866

commit_message:
Check Content-Length header according to RFC 7230

"A server MUST NOT send a Content-Length header field in any
response with a status code of 1xx (Informational) or 204 (No
Content)."

Change-Id: Ib1142245bb1a5c87408978b30dce694c5b520fbb
Related-Bug: 1537811

commit_message:
Nova base cleanups for hiera json hook

This patch resolves an issue with nova-base.yaml that prevents
it from working with the new heat hiera agent hook (which
uses Json instead of Yaml).

It updates the service so that we only set the upgrade level if it
is not an empty string.

Partial-bug: #1596373

Change-Id: I595f2e16c33a6f935c7ca8935fec445d19c7b8f3

commit_message:
Show tab label in Admin CreateSubnet/UpdateSubnet form

It seems workflows.Action does not support inheritance of Django
Meta class. Child classes must declare Meta class again.
Otherwise, class name is shown as a tab label in a workflow from.

Change-Id: I1bcfd2bde6238af339c2e4a4d84d6544d9c29e6b
Closes-Bug: #1626336

commit_message:
Sync tools/tox_install.sh

Sync tools/tox_install.sh with python-openstackclient. This brings in
the following improvements:

* Do not leave temporary directory around, instead delete temporary
  directory directly after usage (change
  I939eae82dba3287fd4e4086128ebf4609a0e0770).
* Do not set ZUUL_BRANCH explicitely and remove unused if condition
  (change I0077c986a17d6bb92791474e03d1e77776e9382f).

Change-Id: I7b408838a29f33c3747829ecd5f30c8dc967a592

commit_message:
Enable MidoNet element to install MEM

Up until now thorough testing was only conducted with the open source version of
MidoNet.

More repositories are enabled when building a MEM base image: logstash,
vbernat-llpd and elasticsearch.

Also additional RPM packages are installed. This is being done using YUM
directly (due to the fact that we cannot install some packages depending
on certain conditions).

Change-Id: Ic88f268f783fcb014d1d19988780758cba762e57

commit_message:
Add support for new rest api notification-type-list

 As part of this blueprint we have added a new rest api
GET /v2.0/notification-methods/types.  This patch adds
support for that api in the client.

Change-Id: I322d1277c1859c990e150f22eceff122ffd77cea
Partially-implements: blueprint notification-engine-plugin

Refactoring inventory generation data manipulation

Segmenting out changes to the inventory generation script which are
related to datastructure manipulations in preparation for segmenting
out storage-related operations.

This completes the body verification for the force_complete
action for server migrations.

This is only supported with microversion >= 2.22 and only for
in-progress live migrations, on unlocked servers that are in
active/migrating status.

There is also a note as not all compute drivers support this
action. See bug 1641753 for details.

Part of blueprint api-ref-in-rst-ocata

Change-Id: I9cd6cf35b4b5828f0f4acde168cda2beedd902f4
'}]
commit_message:
api-ref: body verification for force_complete server migration

This completes the body verification for the force_complete
action for server migrations.

This is only supported with microversion >= 2.22 and only for
in-progress live migrations, on unlocked servers that are in
active/migrating status.

There is also a note as not all compute drivers support this
action. See bug 1641753 for details.

Part of blueprint api-ref-in-rst-ocata

Change-Id: I9cd6cf35b4b5828f0f4acde168cda2beedd902f4

commit_message:
api-ref: body verification for list server migrations

This completes the body verification for listing server
migrations.

Note that the code currently filters such that only in-progress
live migration records are returned. This was also only available
with microversion >= 2.23.

Part of blueprint api-ref-in-rst-ocata

Change-Id: I3a785dad690eee80ec1fd50ebc9fd3f7484dc344

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-15 14:15:59.000000000', 'files': ['os_net_config/tests/test_impl_ifcfg.py', 'os_net_config/tests/test_objects.py', 'os_net_config/tests/test_impl_eni.py', 'os_net_config/objects.py'], 'message': 'Add ovs_fail_mode option for OVS bridges

commit_message:
Add ovs_fail_mode option for OVS bridges

This patch adds an option "ovs_fail_mode" with a default value of
'standalone'. This is written to the interface configuration data as
part of the ovs_extra options.

Closes-Bug: #1640812

Change-Id: I2f30e56ff9fbda7beac21d95d15dbde0b01ba451

commit_message:
Add support for name replacement in OVS_EXTRA

While primarily to work around a heat issue that prevents intrinsic
functions from being used for parameters being passed to NetworkConfig
resources, this could be generally useful in other ways.

Partial-Bug: #1640812
Change-Id: Ie9001f1d41f514666a44c8d9295b78a13e2108dc

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 8099, 'name': 'Graham Hayes', 'email': 'gr@ham.ie', 'username': 'graham'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-11-09 17:19:09.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/badges/.htaccess', 'test-requirements.txt', 'doc/source/conf.py', 'doc/source/_exts/badges.py'], 'message': 'Generate badges for teams and deliverables

Adds a plugin for sphinx for generating badges for teams and
deliverables to use in READMEs, docs sites, etc. A badge corresponds
to a tag.

This plugin generates an `svg` image containing team tags and the
deliverable tags for each repo listed. Each tag corresponds to an SVG
image. All the tags are bundled in the same SVG image whose filename
corresponds to the repo name.

Each badge points to the tag link in the governance website.

This not handled yet:

- This doesn't handle "unofficial" projects, which would be nice to
  have.  If a project tries to access `project-team.svg` tag, instead of
  returning 404, we could return a `project:unofficial` badge.

- Specialized colors for some tags. We might want to use different colors
  for some groups. Team tags could be orange, etc.

- Group/Order tags generation by tag groups

Here's a dummy repo created as an example of how this work would be
consumed (or look like):

- https://github.com/flaper87/badges-tester

Change-Id: Ic70c17b60c0107e40b78bf21dc3a68c558eee06f
'}]
commit_message:
Generate badges for teams and deliverables

Adds a plugin for sphinx for generating badges for teams and
deliverables to use in READMEs, docs sites, etc. A badge corresponds
to a tag.

This plugin generates an `svg` image containing team tags and the
deliverable tags for each repo listed. Each tag corresponds to an SVG
image. All the tags are bundled in the same SVG image whose filename
corresponds to the repo name.

Each badge points to the tag link in the governance website.

This not handled yet:

- This doesn't handle "unofficial" projects, which would be nice to
  have.  If a project tries to access `project-team.svg` tag, instead of
  returning 404, we could return a `project:unofficial` badge.

- Specialized colors for some tags. We might want to use different colors
  for some groups. Team tags could be orange, etc.

- Group/Order tags generation by tag groups

Here's a dummy repo created as an example of how this work would be
consumed (or look like):

- https://github.com/flaper87/badges-tester

Change-Id: Ic70c17b60c0107e40b78bf21dc3a68c558eee06f

subject: rename 'tox' macro to 'run-tox'
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-15 10:54:41.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/infra.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/tripleo.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/infra-publish-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/windmill.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/python-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/api-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/specs-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/manuals-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/grenade.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': "rename 'tox' macro to 'run-tox'

JJB already has a tox module[1].  Defining a macro with the same name is
confusing and may cause problems when attempting to use this macro
elsewhere. Renaming it to something else should clear things up.

This is the warning from JJB:

$ jenkins-jobs test -o out ../project-config/jenkins/jobs
WARNING:jenkins_jobs.registry:You have a macro ('tox') defined for
'builder' component type that is masking an inbuilt definition

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/jenkins-job-builder/builders.html#builders.tox

Change-Id: I6946229f6e94a5f4c10d6a5fc3b7049adeacacb1
"}]
commit_message:
rename 'tox' macro to 'run-tox'

JJB already has a tox module[1].  Defining a macro with the same name is
confusing and may cause problems when attempting to use this macro
elsewhere. Renaming it to something else should clear things up.

This is the warning from JJB:

$ jenkins-jobs test -o out ../project-config/jenkins/jobs
WARNING:jenkins_jobs.registry:You have a macro ('tox') defined for
'builder' component type that is masking an inbuilt definition

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/jenkins-job-builder/builders.html#builders.tox

Change-Id: I6946229f6e94a5f4c10d6a5fc3b7049adeacacb1

commit_message:
Don't try to delete trust if trustor not found

Keystone deletes the trust when delete the trustor, so
don't try to delete the trust again in heat delete stack
with another user in same project.

Closes-Bug: #1634362

commit_message:
Make RBDImageMetadata and RBDVolumeIOWrapper re-usable

Now, both Cinder and os-brick projects have RBDVolumeIOWrapper and
RBDImageMetadata classes. This patch syncs code between them to remove
code duplication once new os-brick will be released.

Change-Id: I7d2b2f6ff90b33fe614efd0ff10dbd3b933fd92e

subject: Fix ceilometer bootstrap
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-15 13:06:06.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/ceilometer/tasks/bootstrap.yml'], 'message': 'Fix ceilometer bootstrap

It looks like Ansible 2.0 has some problems with failed_when lists:
	https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/13905

failed_when: '"already" not in database.stdout
             and database.stdout.split()[4] != "connecting"'

Closes-Bug: #1641113
Change-Id: Idb3437e4e942f90dd08de75a67f9554a83dbeeb9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ceilometer bootstrap

It looks like Ansible 2.0 has some problems with failed_when lists:
	https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/13905

failed_when: '"already" not in database.stdout
             and database.stdout.split()[4] != "connecting"'

Closes-Bug: #1641113
Change-Id: Idb3437e4e942f90dd08de75a67f9554a83dbeeb9

subject: Move devstack updown test to Xenial
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-16 00:24:43.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': 'Move devstack updown test to Xenial

The devstack "updown" test is still running on Trusty, making it the
defacto devstack/trusty tester ... a role it is not well suited for.
When this test works, it cleans up after itself and thus deletes all
it's logs, making it hard to compare anything when something goes
wrong.

A follow-on change will propose a specific Trusty job for this

Change-Id: If05224a2d5d880a2affc8d0f2ed5e0b8f554f022
'}]
commit_message:
Move devstack updown test to Xenial

The devstack "updown" test is still running on Trusty, making it the
defacto devstack/trusty tester ... a role it is not well suited for.
When this test works, it cleans up after itself and thus deletes all
it's logs, making it hard to compare anything when something goes
wrong.

A follow-on change will propose a specific Trusty job for this

Change-Id: If05224a2d5d880a2affc8d0f2ed5e0b8f554f022

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-15 12:50:23.000000000', 'files': ['validations/dhcp-introspection.yaml', 'validations/dhcp-provisioning.yaml'], 'message': "Fix the DHCP validations

Some of the environments don't have virtualenv installed by default
which makes the `pip` module fail.

In addition, the latest release of scapy seems broken on RHEL (from
scapy.all import BOOTP raises an exception) so we explicitly specify an
older release that works.

Partial-Bug: #1634023
Change-Id: I5bfd1d38a647c6846d4889c0ec7a8a2d659f7647

"}]
commit_message:
Fix the DHCP validations

Some of the environments don't have virtualenv installed by default
which makes the `pip` module fail.

In addition, the latest release of scapy seems broken on RHEL (from
scapy.all import BOOTP raises an exception) so we explicitly specify an
older release that works.

Partial-Bug: #1634023
Change-Id: I5bfd1d38a647c6846d4889c0ec7a8a2d659f7647
(cherry picked from commit 32620fe025dc416c51c8ecca25a1f1ce8ceb8d7a)

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-15 00:01:29.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py'], 'message': 'Fix "failed unplugging ha interface" error when deleting router

Deleting router namespaces happens before deleting router ha interface.
So it will fail when deleting router ha interface. The change
is to remove router ha interface before deleting router namespace.

Change-Id: I3d936701c9dac7671f12e1966449662988a0f26a
Closes-Bug: #1629159
Related-Bug: #1488730
'}]
commit_message:
Fix "failed unplugging ha interface" error when deleting router

Deleting router namespaces happens before deleting router ha interface.
So it will fail when deleting router ha interface. The change
is to remove router ha interface before deleting router namespace.

Change-Id: I3d936701c9dac7671f12e1966449662988a0f26a
Closes-Bug: #1629159
Related-Bug: #1488730

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-17 01:12:21.000000000', 'files': ['searchlightclient/openstack/common/apiclient/base.py', 'searchlightclient/openstack/common/apiclient/fake_client.py'], 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I58188adbbb29582f8c2ad205a4a17d4327157f97
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I58188adbbb29582f8c2ad205a4a17d4327157f97

subject: Clean all then yum update
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-27 22:43:08.000000000', 'files': ['docker/base/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'Clean all then yum update

After repo install the order of update then clean
seems backwards according to a local operator that knows
this more than myself; so this flips the order so that
we clean first, then update so that we ensure we are
not using the old repos.

TrivalFix

Change-Id: Icc63dd3d22d1d713c5700e914c87784e6433b69d
'}]
commit_message:
Clean all then yum update

After repo install the order of update then clean
seems backwards according to a local operator that knows
this more than myself; so this flips the order so that
we clean first, then update so that we ensure we are
not using the old repos.

TrivalFix

Change-Id: Icc63dd3d22d1d713c5700e914c87784e6433b69d

subject: Start grafana-server if horizon is available
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-15 10:36:38.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Start grafana-server if horizon is available

The grafana-server service was not defined in
the ENABLED_SERVICES (aka enable_service in settings).
Since grafana depends on horizon, it does not make sense
to start grafana if horizon is disabled.

Change-Id: Ic8e1d93325c68799c952e82715eeddcdcf85d882
'}]
commit_message:
Start grafana-server if horizon is available

The grafana-server service was not defined in
the ENABLED_SERVICES (aka enable_service in settings).
Since grafana depends on horizon, it does not make sense
to start grafana if horizon is disabled.

Change-Id: Ic8e1d93325c68799c952e82715eeddcdcf85d882

Actions for alarm_definitions can be actually specified

Change-Id: I6f8466c7ef0fc69528d394fb541b7a320607d9b4

commit_message:
Allow to send list of actions from CLI

Actions for alarm_definitions can be actually specified
as a list. However CLI allows to send only single
element. With this commit it will be possible to send
more than one action_id.

Change-Id: I6f8466c7ef0fc69528d394fb541b7a320607d9b4

subject: wsgi: headers is an array
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-14 17:03:43.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/wsgi/apache.pp'], 'message': "wsgi: headers is an array

The keystone vhost contains 'Header undef' which is incorrect.
This is because undef will go throught the apache
puppet module directly to a template that except an array or false:

https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-apache/blob/master/templates/vhost/_header.erb

Change-Id: Iae46695a3d9af6743695506c416b7d41cf6de309
"}]
commit_message:
wsgi: headers is an array

The keystone vhost contains 'Header undef' which is incorrect.
This is because undef will go throught the apache
puppet module directly to a template that except an array or false:

https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-apache/blob/master/templates/vhost/_header.erb

Change-Id: Iae46695a3d9af6743695506c416b7d41cf6de309

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-11-15 18:36:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/security_group/test_neutron_driver.py', 'nova/network/security_group/neutron_driver.py', 'nova/network/security_group/security_group_base.py', 'nova/objects/security_group.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "neutron: actually populate list in populate_security_groups

We're going to store the list of requested security group objects
in the request spec so the neutron security group driver code
needs to actually populate that list now for use in the compute API.

As the nova-network and neutron security group API code is basically
the same for populating that list, the backend-specific implementations
are removed and pulled up into the base security group driver API class.

Since we don't want to actually try and persist this list with the
instance object in the nova database we need to add a check in the
compute API to store an empty list, like the old behavior, when
creating the instance. A later change will use the populated list
to store in the RequestSpec.

Part of blueprint cells-scheduling-interaction

Change-Id: I6139eb92f534f010565fde31661382d33463ae58
"}]
commit_message:
neutron: actually populate list in populate_security_groups

We're going to store the list of requested security group objects
in the request spec so the neutron security group driver code
needs to actually populate that list now for use in the compute API.

As the nova-network and neutron security group API code is basically
the same for populating that list, the backend-specific implementations
are removed and pulled up into the base security group driver API class.

Since we don't want to actually try and persist this list with the
instance object in the nova database we need to add a check in the
compute API to store an empty list, like the old behavior, when
creating the instance. A later change will use the populated list
to store in the RequestSpec.

Part of blueprint cells-scheduling-interaction

Change-Id: I6139eb92f534f010565fde31661382d33463ae58

subject: Allow for specifying a KOLLA_CONFIG_FILE
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 01:10:31.000000000', 'files': ['docker/base/set_configs.py'], 'message': 'Allow for specifying a KOLLA_CONFIG_FILE

Incases where it is useful to place many config.json files
under the same directory (ie one for config_glance_api.json or
one for config_glance_registry.json) we should be able to
specify which file under that directory do we actually want to
use (instead of assuming it is always config.json).

Change-Id: I42eeb093d29bac27d71ee08e55e115c2d8b5e9ae
'}]
commit_message:
Allow for specifying a KOLLA_CONFIG_FILE

Incases where it is useful to place many config.json files
under the same directory (ie one for config_glance_api.json or
one for config_glance_registry.json) we should be able to
specify which file under that directory do we actually want to
use (instead of assuming it is always config.json).

Change-Id: I42eeb093d29bac27d71ee08e55e115c2d8b5e9ae

subject: Fix external Load Balancer deployment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-16 02:30:44.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/pacemaker_resource_restart.sh'], 'message': 'Fix external Load Balancer deployment

Deployments using external LB will file like this:
  deploy_stderr: |
    + RESTART_FOLDER=/var/lib/tripleo/pacemaker-restarts
    + [[ -d /var/lib/tripleo/pacemaker-restarts ]]
    ++ systemctl is-active haproxy
    + haproxy_status=unknown
  deploy_status_code: 3
openstack software deployment show 4f339ca4-7600-4ca0-b0ef-f798bc47b6cf

The reason is that via https://review.openstack.org/#/c/393644/ we
introducted the haproxy restart like this:
haproxy_status=$(systemctl is-active haproxy)
if [ "$haproxy_status" = "active" ]; then
    systemctl reload haproxy
fi

The problem is that if haproxy is not running/installed systemctl
is-active can fail and the script will terminate with an error return
code. Let's just move the call inside the if so the script does not fail
in case haproxy is not there.

The snippet before the change (on a system without haproxy installed):
[root@mrg-09 tmp]# ./test.sh
++ systemctl is-active haproxy
+ haproxy_status=unknown
[root@mrg-09 tmp]# echo $?
3

After this change:
[root@mrg-09 tmp]# ./test.sh
++ systemctl is-active haproxy
+ '[' unknown = active ']'
[root@mrg-09 tmp]# echo $?
0

Change-Id: I837c63a9dbcde8c922f843c442974fa79cf1eede
Closes-Bug: #1641904
(cherry picked from commit bb3c742e36ac86ed41a7705aec05adbaf62098f6)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix external Load Balancer deployment

Deployments using external LB will file like this:
  deploy_stderr: |
    + RESTART_FOLDER=/var/lib/tripleo/pacemaker-restarts
    + [[ -d /var/lib/tripleo/pacemaker-restarts ]]
    ++ systemctl is-active haproxy
    + haproxy_status=unknown
  deploy_status_code: 3
openstack software deployment show 4f339ca4-7600-4ca0-b0ef-f798bc47b6cf

The reason is that via https://review.openstack.org/#/c/393644/ we
introducted the haproxy restart like this:
haproxy_status=$(systemctl is-active haproxy)
if [ "$haproxy_status" = "active" ]; then
    systemctl reload haproxy
fi

The problem is that if haproxy is not running/installed systemctl
is-active can fail and the script will terminate with an error return
code. Let's just move the call inside the if so the script does not fail
in case haproxy is not there.

The snippet before the change (on a system without haproxy installed):
[root@mrg-09 tmp]# ./test.sh
++ systemctl is-active haproxy
+ haproxy_status=unknown
[root@mrg-09 tmp]# echo $?
3

After this change:
[root@mrg-09 tmp]# ./test.sh
++ systemctl is-active haproxy
+ '[' unknown = active ']'
[root@mrg-09 tmp]# echo $?
0

Change-Id: I837c63a9dbcde8c922f843c442974fa79cf1eede
Closes-Bug: #1641904
(cherry picked from commit bb3c742e36ac86ed41a7705aec05adbaf62098f6)

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-11-16 03:08:59.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/horizon.yaml'], 'message': "Horizon service cleanups for hiera json hook

This patch resolves a few issues I noticed when porting our
Horizon service to support the new heat hiera agent hook (which
uses Json instead of Yaml).

 -we only need to set django_debug if the string is non-empty. This
  should match previous behavior.

 -remove the duplicated NeutronMechanismDrivers setting. This is already
  managed in the neutron services and shouldn't be set here.

Change-Id: I473e110bb9b14cb8f57d41c4fc398871548726b0
Partial-bug: #1596373
"}]
commit_message:
Horizon service cleanups for hiera json hook

This patch resolves a few issues I noticed when porting our
Horizon service to support the new heat hiera agent hook (which
uses Json instead of Yaml).

 -we only need to set django_debug if the string is non-empty. This
  should match previous behavior.

 -remove the duplicated NeutronMechanismDrivers setting. This is already
  managed in the neutron services and shouldn't be set here.

Change-Id: I473e110bb9b14cb8f57d41c4fc398871548726b0
Partial-bug: #1596373

commit_message:
Ensure there are fdb_entries before iterating

_get_agent_fdb may return None so we need to check for
that before we try to iterate over a key inside of it
in delete_port_postcommit.

Change-Id: I2256df0e08380e550f32248fb9589ee43b0923ff
(cherry picked from commit 6e0b8c176cfc68a9e034019a0893c8c8fbf50015)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6593, 'name': 'Dirk Mueller', 'email': 'dirk@dmllr.de', 'username': 'dmllr'}, {'_account_id': 8190, 'name': 'Drew Thorstensen (thorst)', 'email': 'thorst@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'thorst'}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 13883, 'name': 'Adam Reznechek', 'email': 'adreznec@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'adrez'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 14221, 'name': 'Dominique Clain', 'email': 'dclain@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'dclain'}, {'_account_id': 14288, 'name': 'Matthew Thode', 'display_name': 'prometheanfire', 'email': 'mthode@mthode.org', 'username': 'prometheanfire'}, {'_account_id': 16710, 'name': 'Eric Berglund', 'email': 'esberglu@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'esberglu'}, {'_account_id': 18876, 'name': 'Amartey Pearson', 'email': 'apearson@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'apearson'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-11-15 19:21:48.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Introduce pypowervm global requirement

This prepares for the upcoming integration of the PowerVM driver into
nova by bringing in the pypowervm requirement.

pypowervm is an open-source library allowing programmatic interaction
with the PowerVM NovaLink REST API.

https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pypowervm/1.0.0.3.9
https://github.com/powervm/pypowervm/

- Is the library actively maintained?

The library is in constant active development, with merges at least
weekly.  Bugs can be reported via launchpad
(https://bugs.launchpad.net/pypowervm/) and are addressed promptly.
The release schedule is deliberately designed to coincide with that of
OpenStack.

- Is the library good code?

pypowervm has been used for the out-of-tree version of nova-powervm
since the liberty release, and as the basis for the pvmctl command line
interface running on the NovaLink management partition.

It is developed and tested with the same rigor and using (at least) the
same processes as OpenStack itself.  This includes:
  - Peer reviews via gerrit.  No approving your own code.
  - Mandatory unit test coverage, automatically validated on each patch,
    and required to pass before merge.
  - PEP8 and sonar enforcement, likewise.
  - Build verification testing (integration with pvmctl), likewise.
  - Integration with nova-powervm through the same automated CI that
    validates nova-powervm itself.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes.  The tox config has py34 and py35 environments.

- Is the library license compatible?

pypowervm is licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

Debian packages are available from the repo:
http://public.dhe.ibm.com/systems/virtualization/Novalink/debian/

RPMs will be available soon.

But the library is distro-independent, and installable from pypi via pip
anywhere that runs.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

There is no other known library that provides the function of pypowervm.
(And if one does exist, there's no way it's as cool as this one.)

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

The library is required to support the PowerVM nova compute driver,
which is being brought in-tree via bp powervm-nova-compute-driver.

The out-of-tree driver can be found here:
https://github.com/openstack/nova-powervm/

Change-Id: I98ede37f94b8779cac5610ef9be7ab057c221627
Partially-Implements: blueprint powervm-nova-compute-driver
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce pypowervm global requirement

This prepares for the upcoming integration of the PowerVM driver into
nova by bringing in the pypowervm requirement.

pypowervm is an open-source library allowing programmatic interaction
with the PowerVM NovaLink REST API.

https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pypowervm/1.0.0.3.9
https://github.com/powervm/pypowervm/

- Is the library actively maintained?

The library is in constant active development, with merges at least
weekly.  Bugs can be reported via launchpad
(https://bugs.launchpad.net/pypowervm/) and are addressed promptly.
The release schedule is deliberately designed to coincide with that of
OpenStack.

- Is the library good code?

pypowervm has been used for the out-of-tree version of nova-powervm
since the liberty release, and as the basis for the pvmctl command line
interface running on the NovaLink management partition.

It is developed and tested with the same rigor and using (at least) the
same processes as OpenStack itself.  This includes:
  - Peer reviews via gerrit.  No approving your own code.
  - Mandatory unit test coverage, automatically validated on each patch,
    and required to pass before merge.
  - PEP8 and sonar enforcement, likewise.
  - Build verification testing (integration with pvmctl), likewise.
  - Integration with nova-powervm through the same automated CI that
    validates nova-powervm itself.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes.  The tox config has py34 and py35 environments.

- Is the library license compatible?

pypowervm is licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

Debian packages are available from the repo:
http://public.dhe.ibm.com/systems/virtualization/Novalink/debian/

RPMs will be available soon.

But the library is distro-independent, and installable from pypi via pip
anywhere that runs.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

There is no other known library that provides the function of pypowervm.
(And if one does exist, there's no way it's as cool as this one.)

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

The library is required to support the PowerVM nova compute driver,
which is being brought in-tree via bp powervm-nova-compute-driver.

The out-of-tree driver can be found here:
https://github.com/openstack/nova-powervm/

Change-Id: I98ede37f94b8779cac5610ef9be7ab057c221627
Partially-Implements: blueprint powervm-nova-compute-driver

subject: Fix scenario tests
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-20 15:04:03.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/scenario/groups/instance_actions_group.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/instance_upgrade_runners.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/groups/configuration_group.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/groups/instance_upgrade_group.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/instance_actions_runners.py'], 'message': 'Fix scenario tests

 - Add tests to assert data survives instance actions such as
   restart, resize and upgrade.

 - Run configuarion update tests before creating new instance
   with config group attached. Updating a config group on an instance
   in BUILD state results in an exception in API because
   the new values cannot be applied to a building instance.
   * This is something we may want to handle in Trove itself.
     It is not entirely clear to me how.
     Once the config values are in prepare we cannot change them
     until the instance goes ACTIVE. A similar issue also apperently
     affects other Trove functions such as modules.
     Throwing the exception and letting the taskmanager retry is
     probably the safest way for now.

Change-Id: Ib19071af23f99b77eec9613157cfa11f00f53078
'}]
commit_message:
Fix scenario tests

 - Add tests to assert data survives instance actions such as
   restart, resize and upgrade.

 - Run configuarion update tests before creating new instance
   with config group attached. Updating a config group on an instance
   in BUILD state results in an exception in API because
   the new values cannot be applied to a building instance.
   * This is something we may want to handle in Trove itself.
     It is not entirely clear to me how.
     Once the config values are in prepare we cannot change them
     until the instance goes ACTIVE. A similar issue also apperently
     affects other Trove functions such as modules.
     Throwing the exception and letting the taskmanager retry is
     probably the safest way for now.

Change-Id: Ib19071af23f99b77eec9613157cfa11f00f53078

subject: Replace retrying with tenacity
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-11-15 04:35:02.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/utils.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server_network_mixin.py', 'heat/engine/clients/os/nova.py', 'heat/objects/resource.py'], 'message': "Replace retrying with tenacity

We are replacing all usages of the 'retrying' package with
'tenacity' as the author of retrying is not actively maintaining
the project. Tenacity is a fork of retrying, but has improved the
interface and extensibility (see [1] for more details). Our end
goal here is removing the retrying package from our requirements.

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the
following major differences to account for:
- Tenacity uses seconds rather than ms as retrying did.
- Tenacity has different kwargs for the decorator and
Retrying class itself.
- Tenacity has a different approach for retrying args by
using classes for its stop/wait/retry kwargs.
- By default tenacity raises a RetryError if a retried callable
times out; retrying raises the last exception from the callable.
Tenacity provides backwards compatibility here by offering
the 'reraise' kwarg.
- Tenacity defines 'time.sleep' as a default value for a kwarg.
That said consumers who need to mock patch time.sleep
need to account for this via mocking of time.sleep before
tenacity is imported.
- For retries that check a result, tenacity will raise if the retried
function raises, whereas retrying retried on all exceptions.

This patch updates all usages of retrying with tenacity.
Unit tests will be added/removed where applicable.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

Closes-Bug: #1635388

Change-Id: Iec0822cc0d5589b04c1764db518478d286455031
"}]
commit_message:
Replace retrying with tenacity

We are replacing all usages of the 'retrying' package with
'tenacity' as the author of retrying is not actively maintaining
the project. Tenacity is a fork of retrying, but has improved the
interface and extensibility (see [1] for more details). Our end
goal here is removing the retrying package from our requirements.

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the
following major differences to account for:
- Tenacity uses seconds rather than ms as retrying did.
- Tenacity has different kwargs for the decorator and
Retrying class itself.
- Tenacity has a different approach for retrying args by
using classes for its stop/wait/retry kwargs.
- By default tenacity raises a RetryError if a retried callable
times out; retrying raises the last exception from the callable.
Tenacity provides backwards compatibility here by offering
the 'reraise' kwarg.
- Tenacity defines 'time.sleep' as a default value for a kwarg.
That said consumers who need to mock patch time.sleep
need to account for this via mocking of time.sleep before
tenacity is imported.
- For retries that check a result, tenacity will raise if the retried
function raises, whereas retrying retried on all exceptions.

This patch updates all usages of retrying with tenacity.
Unit tests will be added/removed where applicable.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

Closes-Bug: #1635388

Change-Id: Iec0822cc0d5589b04c1764db518478d286455031

commit_message:
Allow create image params in glance scenario

Allows users to pass kwargs for creating images and
bootign servers in the CreateImageAndBootInstances
scenario. A deprecation warning will be logged if users
attempt to use the old-style kwargs to provide server
params.

Change-Id: Ie143d47520dbcaf42e6d3366dd723d4da6cb256a

subject: Using assertIsNotNone() instead of assertNotEqual(None)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-15 04:42:26.000000000', 'files': ['integration/tests/integration/tests/volumes/driver.py'], 'message': 'Using assertIsNotNone() instead of assertNotEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNotNone(...) is preferred
over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None, ...)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Change-Id: I2f8b1188be4ae7479e7030b02857c2f918cc58e9
'}]
commit_message:
Using assertIsNotNone() instead of assertNotEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNotNone(...) is preferred
over assertNotEqual(None, ...) and assertIsNot(None, ...)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Change-Id: I2f8b1188be4ae7479e7030b02857c2f918cc58e9

commit_message:
Add Apache 2.0 license to source file

As per OpenStack licensing guide lines [1]:
[H102 H103] Newly contributed Source Code should be licensed under
the Apache 2.0 license.
[H104] Files with no code shouldn't contain any license header nor
comments, and must be left completely empty.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing

Change-Id: I9169b9d9d3f4e2fd96c70e7f99c21f5bcc9e818f

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Useful name convention for CG names

Storage group names(Consistency Group name in Openstack)
have been updated to reflect a name that will be useful
for the admins whowill access the VMAX using SYMCLI/univmax
for any troubleshooting, analysis or scripting.

Change-Id: I13e96de97ca134aeff311326209bcbf7c53cf894
Closes-Bug: #1619656

In order to work properly, magnum requires at least to configure

magnum::clients that take care of client basic configuration

Change-Id: Ic33aba69873e0aeb79546fe25f158604229a54a5

commit_message:
Add magnum::clients class

magnum configuration contains some service clients configuration
section.

In order to work properly, magnum requires at least to configure
cinder_client/region_name. This patch adds a new manifest
magnum::clients that take care of client basic configuration
including region_name and endpoint_type. In future, more options
can be added.

Change-Id: Ic33aba69873e0aeb79546fe25f158604229a54a5

commit_message:
docker-cmd hook

This hook takes the same format as the docker-compose hook, but makes
calls directly to the docker command rather than calling
docker-compose.

This hook currently supports the docker-compose v1 format, but in the
future will support other formats such as the kubernetes pod format.

TripleO will adopt this hook and will transition to using the pod
format when this hook supports it.

Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I699107c3df64723a945c5d5ac82ae3a48b76700e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-11 19:15:08.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/tools/ironic/scripts/cleanup-node.sh', 'devstack/tools/ironic/scripts/setup-network.sh', 'devstack/tools/ironic/scripts/create-node.sh'], 'message': "Add PS4 for better logfile information of devstack runs

The scripts
    tools/ironic/scripts/cleanup-node.sh
    tools/ironic/scripts/create-node.sh
    tools/ironic/scripts/setup-network.sh

are executed by sudo and the PS4 value disappears during sudo. Add a
PS4 value so that we get better logs during their execution.

PS4 is used to prefix the tracing output when using:
    'set -x' or 'set -o xtrace'

From the bash manpage:
PS4     The  value  of this parameter is expanded as with PS1 and the
        value is printed before each command bash displays during an
        execution trace.  The first character of PS4 is replicated
        multiple times, as necessary, to indicate multiple levels of
        indirection.  The default is ``+ ''.

Change-Id: If06f079bed16d9c84569594aa64259bf06f91a1e
(cherry picked from commit a78097bf3fcbea81fc00cab10a76c709d2d3a1c2)
"}]
commit_message:
Add PS4 for better logfile information of devstack runs

The scripts
    tools/ironic/scripts/cleanup-node.sh
    tools/ironic/scripts/create-node.sh
    tools/ironic/scripts/setup-network.sh

are executed by sudo and the PS4 value disappears during sudo. Add a
PS4 value so that we get better logs during their execution.

PS4 is used to prefix the tracing output when using:
    'set -x' or 'set -o xtrace'

From the bash manpage:
PS4     The  value  of this parameter is expanded as with PS1 and the
        value is printed before each command bash displays during an
        execution trace.  The first character of PS4 is replicated
        multiple times, as necessary, to indicate multiple levels of
        indirection.  The default is ``+ ''.

Change-Id: If06f079bed16d9c84569594aa64259bf06f91a1e
(cherry picked from commit a78097bf3fcbea81fc00cab10a76c709d2d3a1c2)

Change-Id: I275504c5d6b20c5f239adfd200915f29b3d9f7bf

commit_message:
WIP: Add fail_mode workaround for connectivity issues on reboot

Neutron configures its OVS bridges with the secure fail_mode. This is
causing problems on reboot in newer kernels like the one in RHEL 7.3
where network connectivity isn't being restored if neutron is configured
to manage the same OVS bridge as the control plane, management network
etc.

Change-Id: I275504c5d6b20c5f239adfd200915f29b3d9f7bf
Depends-On: Ie9001f1d41f514666a44c8d9295b78a13e2108dc

subject: Fix external Load Balancer deployment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-15 10:28:44.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/pacemaker_resource_restart.sh'], 'message': 'Fix external Load Balancer deployment

Deployments using external LB will file like this:
  deploy_stderr: |
    + RESTART_FOLDER=/var/lib/tripleo/pacemaker-restarts
    + [[ -d /var/lib/tripleo/pacemaker-restarts ]]
    ++ systemctl is-active haproxy
    + haproxy_status=unknown
  deploy_status_code: 3
openstack software deployment show 4f339ca4-7600-4ca0-b0ef-f798bc47b6cf

The reason is that via https://review.openstack.org/#/c/393644/ we
introducted the haproxy restart like this:
haproxy_status=$(systemctl is-active haproxy)
if [ "$haproxy_status" = "active" ]; then
    systemctl reload haproxy
fi

The problem is that if haproxy is not running/installed systemctl
is-active can fail and the script will terminate with an error return
code. Let's just move the call inside the if so the script does not fail
in case haproxy is not there.

The snippet before the change (on a system without haproxy installed):
[root@mrg-09 tmp]# ./test.sh
++ systemctl is-active haproxy
+ haproxy_status=unknown
[root@mrg-09 tmp]# echo $?
3

After this change:
[root@mrg-09 tmp]# ./test.sh
++ systemctl is-active haproxy
+ '[' unknown = active ']'
[root@mrg-09 tmp]# echo $?
0

Change-Id: I837c63a9dbcde8c922f843c442974fa79cf1eede
Closes-Bug: #1641904
'}]
commit_message:
Fix external Load Balancer deployment

Deployments using external LB will file like this:
  deploy_stderr: |
    + RESTART_FOLDER=/var/lib/tripleo/pacemaker-restarts
    + [[ -d /var/lib/tripleo/pacemaker-restarts ]]
    ++ systemctl is-active haproxy
    + haproxy_status=unknown
  deploy_status_code: 3
openstack software deployment show 4f339ca4-7600-4ca0-b0ef-f798bc47b6cf

The reason is that via https://review.openstack.org/#/c/393644/ we
introducted the haproxy restart like this:
haproxy_status=$(systemctl is-active haproxy)
if [ "$haproxy_status" = "active" ]; then
    systemctl reload haproxy
fi

The problem is that if haproxy is not running/installed systemctl
is-active can fail and the script will terminate with an error return
code. Let's just move the call inside the if so the script does not fail
in case haproxy is not there.

The snippet before the change (on a system without haproxy installed):
[root@mrg-09 tmp]# ./test.sh
++ systemctl is-active haproxy
+ haproxy_status=unknown
[root@mrg-09 tmp]# echo $?
3

After this change:
[root@mrg-09 tmp]# ./test.sh
++ systemctl is-active haproxy
+ '[' unknown = active ']'
[root@mrg-09 tmp]# echo $?
0

Change-Id: I837c63a9dbcde8c922f843c442974fa79cf1eede
Closes-Bug: #1641904

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-11-14 20:56:14.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/use-service-tokens.rst'], 'message': "Send service token along with user tokens

Some operations in Nova could take a long time to complete. During this
time user token associated with this request could expire. When Nova tries
to communicate with other services using the same user token, Keystone fails
to validate the request due to expired token.

Service token will be passed along with user token to communicate with
services when dealing with long running tasks like live migration.
Keystone middlewere trusts that the service got the user token when
it was valid, don't check the expiry date of cert.

Change-Id: I7f5807ed6b998a0d88169dbbf057e22fe2cd9167
"}]
commit_message:
Send service token along with user tokens

Some operations in Nova could take a long time to complete. During this
time user token associated with this request could expire. When Nova tries
to communicate with other services using the same user token, Keystone fails
to validate the request due to expired token.

Service token will be passed along with user token to communicate with
services when dealing with long running tasks like live migration.
Keystone middlewere trusts that the service got the user token when
it was valid, don't check the expiry date of cert.

Change-Id: I7f5807ed6b998a0d88169dbbf057e22fe2cd9167

commit_message:
Use build interval and timeout from conf

Zaqar plugin currently use build timeout and interval
options from a tempest variable which was temporary defined for
baremetal tests only - cls.os.default_params_with_timeout_values

Now below patch remove the baremetal tests from ironic and so
this variable.
- Id518a6d87d0949737cd1c50cb6a83149b85e5f85

This patch fix zaqar to use those required config options directly
from tempest conf.

Change-Id: I8f84177d00cd0f635a45eabe275a51c20761e6cb

[{'number': 30, 'created': '2016-11-09 07:28:45.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/bug-1318544-0a4a04985cc3a091.yaml', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_xenapi.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/vm_utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/stubs.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_vm_utils.py'], 'message': 'XenAPI: Do not rely on XenAPI to get device names

The reason is in some version of xenserver, it assumes all HVM domains
are Windows and returns incorrect device name.
In all xenserver versions the value from XAPI is just a guess and the
guest kernel may decide to use different device name.
With the new method, there is no need of any hacks, such as for
maverick support, etc.

Closes-Bug: #1318544

Change-Id: Ia61d1c212a115168f8a22fc513b6baf2102a30d1
'}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: Do not rely on XenAPI to get device names

The reason is in some version of xenserver, it assumes all HVM domains
are Windows and returns incorrect device name.
In all xenserver versions the value from XAPI is just a guess and the
guest kernel may decide to use different device name.
With the new method, there is no need of any hacks, such as for
maverick support, etc.

Closes-Bug: #1318544

Change-Id: Ia61d1c212a115168f8a22fc513b6baf2102a30d1

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-07 01:47:25.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Send out notification about server group changes when delete instances

Services like Searchlight and Telemetry are listen to
the notification to do their jobs. Take Searchlight as
an example, when an instance has been added to a
server group SL will catch the notification and index
the up-to-date data to its database for searching
perpose.

Currently, when delete instances, the related server
group's member field will also be cleaned, but no
notification will be send out (nova performs direct DB
action):

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#n1862

Take again SearchLight as an example, it cannot
perform sync actions under this situation,
thus the indexed data will be out-of-date.

This patch tries to send out notification about server
group changes when delete instances.

Change-Id: I8bcc67b82b89665cf7e3d6c2566cd814619b4b4f
closes-bug: #1639152
"}]
commit_message:
Send out notification about server group changes when delete instances

Services like Searchlight and Telemetry are listen to
the notification to do their jobs. Take Searchlight as
an example, when an instance has been added to a
server group SL will catch the notification and index
the up-to-date data to its database for searching
perpose.

Currently, when delete instances, the related server
group's member field will also be cleaned, but no
notification will be send out (nova performs direct DB
action):

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#n1862

Take again SearchLight as an example, it cannot
perform sync actions under this situation,
thus the indexed data will be out-of-date.

This patch tries to send out notification about server
group changes when delete instances.

Change-Id: I8bcc67b82b89665cf7e3d6c2566cd814619b4b4f
closes-bug: #1639152

When an exception is caught and rethrown,
it should call 'raise' without any arguments
because it shows the place where an exception
occured initially instead of place where the
exception re-raised

Change-Id: Ic888ac49179056ca4268cb0bebc48ba97f24262b
"}]
commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

When an exception is caught and rethrown,
it should call 'raise' without any arguments
because it shows the place where an exception
occured initially instead of place where the
exception re-raised

Change-Id: Ic888ac49179056ca4268cb0bebc48ba97f24262b

subject: apache: Remove product informations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-20 15:43:45.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': "apache: Remove product informations

By default, the httpd version and the OS type is described in the
HTTP header 'Server'.

Server: Apache/2.4.6 (Red Hat Enterprise Linux)

This patch allows to remove the specific informations related to the
httpd server and the OS.

Change-Id: If514e36605defbeadd91de0b40f24da87e4d9736

commit_message:
apache: Remove product informations

By default, the httpd version and the OS type is described in the
HTTP header 'Server'.

Server: Apache/2.4.6 (Red Hat Enterprise Linux)

This patch allows to remove the specific informations related to the
httpd server and the OS.

Change-Id: If514e36605defbeadd91de0b40f24da87e4d9736

commit_message:
Create new docker command hook

This implements a new hook to run commands with docker directly.
It uses the same interface so that minimal changes will be needed
to the heat templates.

The hook scripts are copied from the heat-templates change
I699107c3df64723a945c5d5ac82ae3a48b76700e. This will be replaced with
a simple package installation when the heat-templates change has been
packaged.

Co-Authored: Flavio Percoco <fpercoco@redhat.com>
Co-Authored: Martin André <m.andre@redhat.com>
Co-Authored: Steve Baker <sbaker@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I1e4d6e5afe41827858d6340f6c4ad9e48158e7e5

commit_message:
Adding ability to do User defined fuzz test

During the first set of tests we did, it became clear that we
would need a way to test specific user provided string and check
them against user defined failure keys.

This test adds that functionality to the suite.

Change-Id: I53833c2ab11813d746d9fc97355adaf51eb6096e

subject: Raise Openstack SDK minimum requirement
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-15 17:56:23.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Raise Openstack SDK minimum requirement

OSC requires an openstacksdk minimum requirement of
0.9.10 for new network commands and features.

0.9.9 is known to have issues, pushing up to 0.9.10
to accomodate both.

Change-Id: I78ec4572d03dbe69dd61023c78fcf105e319a392
'}]
commit_message:
Raise Openstack SDK minimum requirement

OSC requires an openstacksdk minimum requirement of
0.9.10 for new network commands and features.

0.9.9 is known to have issues, pushing up to 0.9.10
to accomodate both.

Change-Id: I78ec4572d03dbe69dd61023c78fcf105e319a392

commit_message:
Document X-Openstack-Request-Id in all responses

Swift returns `X-Openstack-Request-Id` for container and
object requests as well as account.  A couple api-ref docs are
missing this value in the response examples.

Collins', 'email': 'sean@coreitpro.com', 'username': 'scollins'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-26 09:40:49.000000000', 'files': ['lib/keystone'], 'message': 'Unset admin_project config options for Keystone

Until the policy changes land for Nova, Glance, etc, this
value is not used.  Additionally, by having it set, it actually
makes it hard/impossible for the required changes to land in
the other services.  Disable/comment out the changes in the
Keystone specific lib file for now, and we will re-enable once
the Services can make use of them.

Change-Id: Ia1de9083c21107dac2f0abb56bda166bdb37a69d
'}]
commit_message:
Unset admin_project config options for Keystone

Until the policy changes land for Nova, Glance, etc, this
value is not used.  Additionally, by having it set, it actually
makes it hard/impossible for the required changes to land in
the other services.  Disable/comment out the changes in the
Keystone specific lib file for now, and we will re-enable once
the Services can make use of them.

Change-Id: Ia1de9083c21107dac2f0abb56bda166bdb37a69d

commit_message:
defer resource encoding to server

we duplicate encoding in client when it's already handled by server.
this drops client encoding to let server handle it. this will also
avoid any sync issues we might have.

Change-Id: I34786e0d0ad3512d4fabe47403e3b071bb7c162b
